intro: Cracca barbigera, commonly known as the hairy cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a woody stem with a hairy texture, and its leaves are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small yellow flowers that are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, attracting various pollinators. Cracca barbigera is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
